page.title: 18LAYER CHURCH
page.content: {LAYER CHURCH _}St.John the Baptist The record of the church's existence is in the charter of 1128. The church belonged first to the Abbey of St.John in Colchester and then to the Priors of St.Botolph.The monks of St.Botolph had to work hard to rebuild the nave and tower in 1350 after it had been allowed to fall into disrepair as a result of the decrease in population following the Black Death.The church is architecturally an interesting one and the Registers,which date from 1752,show the names of the forbears of some present day village families. {OLD FORGE GARAGE _ }was originally the Blacksmith's forge built in the 18th century. The anvil remains inside and the horse_hole is still in the wall. It became a garage in 1920. One of the hand petrol pumps is in Colchester Museum.The Morse family own the garage
